channel.title: Commercial MMORPG Ryzom goes Open Source
channel.description:
We are proud to announce that Ryzom is now the first commercial MMORPG to go completely Open Source in partnership with the Free Software Foundation! The entire source code of Ryzom (client, server-side and tools) is now distributed under the GNU AGPLv3 free license, while the graphic assets of the game are available on the terms of Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike (CC BY-SA) license. Specifically, what will Open Source bring to Ryzom? - Ryzom will never disappear, it has become immortal. - New content patches, as well as the other additions and improvements will be more frequent. - Bugs will be found and fixed promptly. - Linux and MacOS Ryzom versions may appear soon, with the help of the Open-Source developers community. - Everybody can take part to the Ryzom's development, or use Ryzom as a foundation for their own personal project.
Engine features: http://dev.ryzom.com/wiki/ryzom/RyzomFeatures Personally i think this is fantastic as this is a pretty damn well made mmorpg. Not yet another grindfest!

item.title: Commercial MMORPG Ryzom goes Open Source
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:3, topic:341664”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=438062.msg3219447#msg3219447 date=1275052146]
Personally i think this is fantastic as this is a pretty damn well made mmorpg. Not yet another grindfest!
[/quote]

Does that mean it’s another gameplay-less “sandbox” (aka lazy developed game)?[/quote]Moar like a well-designed sandbox with tons of content.

Read full topic

item.title: Commercial MMORPG Ryzom goes Open Source
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

We are proud to announce that Ryzom is now the first commercial MMORPG to go completely Open Source in partnership with the Free Software Foundation! The entire source code of Ryzom (client, server-side and tools) is now distributed under the GNU AGPLv3 free license, while the graphic assets of the game are available on the terms of Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike (CC BY-SA) license.

Specifically, what will Open Source bring to Ryzom?

  • Ryzom will never disappear, it has become immortal.
  • New content patches, as well as the other additions and improvements will be more frequent.
  • Bugs will be found and fixed promptly.
  • Linux and MacOS Ryzom versions may appear soon, with the help of the Open-Source developers community.
  • Everybody can take part to the Ryzom’s development, or use Ryzom as a foundation for their own personal project.

Engine features: http://dev.ryzom.com/wiki/ryzom/RyzomFeatures

Personally i think this is fantastic as this is a pretty damn well made mmorpg. Not yet another grindfest!
